Player History
Drafted in 2nd round, 38th overall pick, by San Francisco in 1969...
Injured on 6/17/1970 with a Strained Elbow Ligament, out for 1-2 weeks...
Injured on 4/4/1972 with a Strained Hamstring Muscle, out for 1-2 weeks...
Injured on 8/6/1972 with a Sore Knee, out for 1-2 weeks...
Had first career hit (homerun) on 6/4/1973, off Nolan Ryan (HOU)...
Won Player of the Week award on 8/26/1973, hitting .440 with 3 HR, 7 RBI...
Won World Series with San Francisco in 1973...
Traded from San Francisco to Cincinnati on 7/31/1975 (Going to SF: 3B B. Robertson. Going to CIN: CF M. Anderson)...
Injured on 8/4/1975 with a Tight Elbow, out for 1-2 weeks...
Won Batter of the Month award on 10/1/1975, hitting .324 with 8 HR, 26 RBI...
Was selected to the 1976 Allstar game...
